values:
Um so I'm sucking at updating this thing...whoops.

I frickin love senior year, thank the lord for stat and no more Ms. Smith!  Cross Country rocks and I'm psyched for *Wilmington* [ruuunn girl].  I have so much shit to do and I'm loving it, 180 from last year when I sat on my butt all day-although I do miss after school Wendy's runs along with other things...but I'm keeping in mind that change isn't a bad thing, cuz lord knows things have changed around here.  Hopefully some things will never change, I love my girls way too much I don't know what I would have done without yall these past couple of months-hell yeah Senior Women ***best six you'll ever have***

 

all you need is...

LOVE
okay so, went to one of Steven's get-togethers, if you will...and i sat on the couch, drinking chocolate milk and flipping through Harry Potter. look up 'dork' in the dictionary-it says Mariah.

humm so, running is really satisfying

i need to get   dRu  uu  nk

where's my damn chapstick!            

                            i      want        it       !

 

blood makes me cry

maybe i spoke too soon, things aren't as good as i thought

 

 

                  but there is something to be said for driving in the rain and thinking about how it used to be...

 

  i'm can't get to the beach fast enough

I haven't written in a long time cuz i've actually been busy...for once this summer! So here's a recap of the last couple of weeks:

  • had a killer 'couples massage' with Logan...ooh yeah
  • got my first ever pedicure, complements of April
  • had a lovely joint birthday party
  • went to a couple trivia nights @ mellow and witnessed a roach spearing...with a fork
  • went four-wheeling for the first time = fun
  • saw Sisterhood/Pants had the scariest car ride of my life haha
  • went to a funeral, ate good food and busted out some rap in a Lexus
  • went to Asheville/Biltmore Estate/Grove Park Inn = gorgeous, i <3 the mountains
  • spent the night with Erica and Heather and snuck Bianca out of her house...sneaky sneaky
  • had lunch at Olive Garden with the girls and did some undercover mission work
  • and of course played the same songs over and over on the guitar and bummed it at the pool

it's been good lately.

i gotta get up early tomorrow so i should be off to bed---

LOVE

She draws the shade and hangs her head to cry

                                           She wonders how it ever got this crazy
                   She thinks about a boy she knew in school

    Did she get tired or did she just get lazy?

   

                                                        She's so far gone she feels just like a fool

"don't say anything that'll get you arrested..." :

                   'Fuck You'

 

LOVE

thoughts:

-birthday's are, sadly, over-rated

-last summer was so much better than this summer

-can't listen to Jack Johnson any more and it is  s a d  because i really liked him

-i have done nothing of any concequence this whole summer, and i feel like a waste

-you can't live in the past, even though, many times, it's the happiest place you can find

-the strumming of guitar and the sound of a kiss are the best sounds in the world [even though i used to be super grossed out by it]

-i don't understand how thoughts/feelings can result in a physical reaction [example: the feeling at the pit of your stomach you get at night when you crawl into bed and realize you have no one that cares 'how your day was' or cares enough to listen to all of your stupid thoughts that accumulate in your head through the course of the day] 

-hoping logan/my party will be as pretty and lovely and fun and special as planned

-then again, planning is over-rated, think about it-the best days are never planned

-change is scary

-i really love my friends

-these 'elf grahams' im eating are suprizingly addictive

-i miss forehead kisses

-memories are bittersweet

-straws didn't do anything to me, why do i chew on them so viciously?

-wanting something you can't have is the most frustrating thing on the face of the planet!

-rory gilmore puts it nicely when she says that after saying 'sucks' so much, it loses all meaning.

Well nothing too exciting lately...just a general loveliness of pool and friends and girly spend-the-nights and April's kitten <3! and food [b/c what event of any importance does not revovle around food?]

my birthday is soon, excitment, but i can't help but feel like something is missing...

PLUS i miss my Elyssa! we must hang out soon

LOVE

Okay, I'm officially obsessed with "Dust in the Wind". As in-if I died tomorrow, that would be the song played at my funeral; as in if any boy wanted to get me in bed, all he would have to do is play that song [ya know, get those candles lit...set the mood, ha good times]; as in I might move to Kansas to get better connected with the song/band [okay that might by a little drastic] but you get the picture...it's a good one. PLUS I was playing it in the car with my dad and he said it was my mom's favorite song back in day. Coincidence? I think not.

 

So I'm killin at guitar, I can play "Ode to Joyous Rock" and "Rock to My Lue" like nobody's business [don't you love how they give them 'rockus' names [if you will] so you feel cool when you play um? haha.] Hopefully by the end of the summer I'll be able to belt out a song or two...we'll see how that goes.

 

I've also decided that I'm way to predictable, when Steven guessed what I do with my days down to a T. I was hoping by dying my hair I'd seem edgy-er, ya know-hardcore, unpredictable [ha]. But I guess no matter how hard I try I'm still gonna be the same Mariah, picking wildflowers and all.

 

LOVE

Technically, I've been having a good summer ya know?  Been on some road trips, hung out with people I love, had good food, relaxed, dyed some hair, had some laughs...but I can't help but think about the only thing I don't have and it seems to be the only thing that I truly want.  And it  s u c k s  to say the least.

But lets concentrate on the good parts...A couple nights ago Heather and Steph and I went to Tony Roma's and had lovely conversation-i hearted it.  Then last night Lindsey and Mikol and I went to see his new house being built in the gorgeous country and had some pizza and then Lindsey and I dyed our hair...again!  So as if we hadn't seen enough of eachother...we went to Mikol's today and did some rasslin' PLUS, now Mikol and I are "even". HA .  Finished off the night with some ice cream with Steven and father's day present shopping with Kat [love you!]

I'm getting guitar lessons for my birthday, so I'm off to practice!

LOVE

Went swimming at Amanda's uncle's million dollar estate overlooking the lake with Manda April and Heather.  We played dorky pool games and I found a boat to have my birthday on! Too bad I would be the only one that could fit on it...humm. Oh well, still have a few more weeks before i turn 17! exciting

So then, Lindsey and I had the great idea of going on a scavenger hunt...but we gave up for various reasons, and went to Qdoba's with Max's crew [minus Max]  It was lovely, they are quite entertaining I have to say, you just gotta watch out for Harrison's 'overexposure' if you will, and Ben and his umm passion for girls and cigarettes.  So off to Leah's we went, where we played "Ant's in Your Pants", poor Dave just has no future in the sport, I have to say.

On the way home, Mikol called, so Linds and I serenaded him with "I Got a Bad Case of Lovin' You"...lucky guy.  We talked into the night while he strolled along the dock, conquered the cap of a Corona or five, and swung in foreign hammocks-because he's on vacation like everyone else-while I laid on my bed cuz I'm stuck at home! AH

Things to look forward to:

           *job and Ben and Jerry's [maybe]

         *Checking the Rain!...finally! love me some riding in the back of Mikol's jeep and "enjoying the

              pleasure of eachother's company..."

           *my birthday! and hopefully Logan and my party...if we ever come up with something to do

 

LOVE

Yesterday was the definition of boredom and its destructive effects. First April and Linds and I had a McAllister's picnic on a bridge and watched a bird catch and eat a fish and then contemplated the mating techniques of dragonflies (ie: do they have 'plevi' to thrust?). 

It's easy to see that we were bored of that quickly.  So what else is there to do on Saturday afternoon but go on a roadtrip.  Yes thats right, we hit the highway with our trusty Doobie Bros. and successfully navigated the town of Fairview in Union Co.  

Soo when all of this excitement was over and done with we were still not satisfied-and to the drug store we went.  We left with bottles of "Electric Black", "Hot Mahogany" and "Sunset"...hair dye that is.  April's mom wouldn't let her dye her hair [guh] BUT she rebelliously dyed some streaks but to no avail.  So she assisted Lindsey and I as we spread purple and orange mousse on our hair [yikes! needless to say I was freaking out].  After two sinkfuls of grape and tomato colored water and one purple scalp  and one lodged toothbrush and about 2 hours later we had...the exact same color hair as we did when we started. HA funny how things work out. But hey, if i stand in the sun then sometimes it reflects some red, sorta. And Lindsey's hair is definitely black now...instead of dark dark dark brown!

Well Lindsey and I ended the night with some ice cream, a nice dead bird and Finding Neverland.  But we were too distracted with missing people to follow any kind of story line.  Nights = too much time to think = not fun.  Too bad you aren't just on vacation.

So summer got off to a rough start, to say the least, but it's working out better than expected.  Erica has started me my very own livejournal [i heart her] so that i have something to do this summer!  My life isn't exactly exciting, so i appologize in advance for rubbing off my boredom onto any unsuspecting readers. Oh and also bare with me and my spelling, as most know, its not my forte.

Last night i got to spend time with the loves of my life: Kat and Lindsey!!  We were suppose to go see Max's band play...but some bitch ass lady wouldn't rent them a Uhaul.  So instead we got some Chinese food at the Wok (which oddly is pronounced the same as 'walk'...humm), and the band played at their house instead. Let me tell you, they know how to rock out-haha.  The performance was complete with, as Liz put it, the first mosh on a bed...also known as sex. We will have to put project "favorite panties" into action soon, too bad we are gonna have to change the name cuz that word makes me cringe...  

I came home today to flowers on my doorstep <3


LOVE
